solution_line_template: First, if the a full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches of air, then two empty tires need: {tire_capacity} cubic inches/tire * {num_flat_tires} tires = <<{tire_capacity}*{num_flat_tires}={air_needed_flat_tires}>>{air_needed_flat_tires} cubic inches.

So, we find the 40%-full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches * ({percent_needed_40_num}%) = <<{tire_capacity}*({percent_needed_40_num}*{percent_factor})={air_needed_40_percent_tire}>>{air_needed_40_percent_tire} cubic inches.

So, the 70%-full tire needs {tire_capacity} cubic inches * ({percent_needed_70_num}%) = <<{tire_capacity}*({percent_needed_70_num}*{percent_factor})={air_needed_70_percent_tire}>>{air_needed_70_percent_tire} cubic inches.

Now add up the needs of all the tires to find the total number of cubic inches needed: {air_needed_flat_tires} cubic inches + {air_needed_40_percent_tire} cubic inches + {air_needed_70_percent_tire} cubic inches = <<{air_needed_flat_tires}+{air_needed_40_percent_tire}+{air_needed_70_percent_tire}={total_air_needed_calculated}>>{total_air_needed_calculated} cubic inches.

Finally, if the pumps each hold {air_per_pump} cubic inches, the total number of pumps needed is {total_air_needed_for_pumps_calc} cubic inches / {air_per_pump} cubic inches/pump = {total_pumps} pumps.
